title: File is damaged and cant be opened M3 Pro Macos Sonoma
body: tried the last 3 versions, none of them worked and show as damaged
author: DerpcatMusic

comments.body:
Hiya @DerpcatMusic! sorry for the late response. 

Yeah this issue happens because Apple has increased restriction with Gatekeeper on the newer versions of MacOS. Luckily, there is a way to still make it work.

1. **Open Terminal**:
   - You can open Terminal from the Applications > Utilities folder, or press `Cmd + Space`, type "Terminal," and hit Enter.

2. **Navigate to the App Location**:
   - Use the `cd` command to go to the folder where your app is located. For example, if the app is in the Downloads folder, you would type:
     ```bash
     cd ~/Downloads
     ```

3. **Remove the Quarantine Attribute**:
   - Run the following command, replacing `Comet.app` with the actual name of your app:
     ```bash
     xattr -d com.apple.quarantine Comet.app
     ```
   - This removes the quarantine flag that macOS automatically sets on downloaded applications, which is what blocks it from opening.

4. **Open the App**:
   - Now that the quarantine attribute has been removed, you should be able to open the app by double-clicking it in Finder.

#### Alternative: If You‚Äôre Using a Path

If your app is in a custom location or has spaces in the name, you may want to use the full path. Here‚Äôs an example:
```bash
xattr -d com.apple.quarantine "~/Downloads/Comet.app"
```

### Verification

You can check if the quarantine attribute was successfully removed by running:
```bash
xattr Comet.app
```
If `com.apple.quarantine` no longer appears in the output, the quarantine flag has been successfully removed. 

Let me know if you run into any more issues!

Thank you I really appreciate it! Would be great to add it in the document of comet incase it's not there :)

Best,
Daniel Elmaliah.

title: Add an easy way to extract audio from video.
body: Add an easy way to extract audio from video.
author: asdefasdf

comments.body:
Thanks for your suggestion!

While extracting audio from video files is a useful feature, Comet is focused on simple, streamlined media conversion. Adding features like audio extraction would move Comet toward video editing, which isn‚Äôt the main goal of the app. Our aim is to keep Comet lightweight and easy to use for basic media conversions.

There are several great tools available for more advanced tasks like audio extraction. For now, we‚Äôll be keeping Comet focused on its core functionality.

Thank you again for your input!

There are other tools specifically tailored for media manipulation and editing, while Comet is intended to remain a lightweight solution for file conversion and compression.

If you‚Äôre looking for more advanced video editing features, we recommend exploring software that's designed specifically for those tasks.

However, if you‚Äôre looking for more advanced media editing tools, there are other great applications available that specialize in these functions. title: Suggestions for adding a feature to compress video files or images.
body:
Suggestions for adding a feature to compress video files or images.
Without any deterioration in quality.
author: asdefasdf

comments.body:
Thank you for your suggestion!

Adding a feature to compress video files or images is an interesting idea. However, compression without any deterioration in quality can be quite tricky. In most cases, compression inherently involves some form of quality trade-off, especially for video files. That said, we can explore options like **lossless compression**, where files are reduced in size without sacrificing quality, though this still has its limits in terms of efficiency.

If you have specific ideas or methods in mind for achieving this, we‚Äôd love to see your thoughts in the form of a pull request! Contributions to this kind of feature would be a valuable addition to Comet, and we welcome the input and collaboration of the community.

Thanks again for the suggestion, and we‚Äôre excited to see how this project evolves with everyone‚Äôs help!

title: Suggestions for improving the Comet program.
body:
Suggestions for improving the Comet program.
-When switching from a dark to a light theme, the animation twitches. The same is true on the other side.
It is necessary to ensure smooth running.
-Expand the range of formats available for converting images.
-The Windows installer works fine: installation is silent, but it would be nice to be able to select installation paths.
author: asdefasdf

comments.body:
Hi, thank you for your suggestions for improving Comet!

- **Theme switching animation:** We‚Äôre aware of the slight twitch when switching between themes. This is related to how CSS transitions are handled, but we‚Äôll continue looking into ways to improve the smoothness where possible.

- **Expanding image formats:** Expanding the range of supported image formats is definitely something we‚Äôve considered. However, supporting more formats would require relying on additional third-party libraries or executables, which might increase the complexity of the project. We‚Äôll explore this option further to see if we can strike a balance.

- **Windows installer paths:** I appreciate the suggestion! The ability to choose installation paths is a great idea, and I‚Äôll make sure this is included in future development discussions. Stay tuned for updates!

Additionally, if you‚Äôd like to contribute to these improvements directly, we‚Äôd love to see a pull request! Contributions from the community really help the project grow, and we‚Äôre happy to collaborate on features like these. Please feel free to submit PRs if you have ideas for implementing these changes.

Thanks again for your feedback, and let‚Äôs keep improving Comet together!

title: Image conversion
body:
### Description

<!-- Description of the requested configuration -->

This PR requests the addition of an image conversion feature to the Comet media converter. The application currently supports video and audio conversion, but users could greatly benefit from the ability to convert images into various formats as well. The addition of image conversion will further establish Comet as a versatile media conversion tool.

### Feature Details

<!-- Please describe the now requesting feature to the best of your abilities. -->

The requested feature should allow users to convert image files between different popular formats such as JPEG, PNG, BMP, and others. This feature should be integrated seamlessly with the existing bulk file conversion system, allowing users to convert multiple image files at once.

Here are the main requirements for the feature:

- **Supported Formats:** The image conversion feature should support the most common image formats, including but not limited to JPEG, PNG, BMP, GIF, and TIFF.
- **Bulk Image Conversion:** Users should be able to convert multiple images simultaneously, just like they currently can with video and audio files.
- **Output Settings:** There should be options for configuring image quality and format, similar to how video and audio output settings are currently handled.
- **Real-Time Feedback:** The conversion progress for images should be displayed in the same way as it is for video and audio, including real-time updates and error handling.
- **Performance Considerations:** The image conversion should be optimized for speed and resource efficiency, powered by FFmpeg.

#### Additional Information

<!-- Please describe the now requesting feature to the best of your abilities. -->

The image conversion feature will elevate Comet to a more complete media conversion tool, handling all major media types (video, audio, and images). This enhancement would be particularly valuable for users who need to work with multiple types of media files and wish to handle them all within a single, user-friendly application.
